body:
> Are you proposing the async API instrumentation?

Yes, I have lost links to many asynchronous calls
Could you give us a brief about what you are trying to do? This is an async API in JDK level, right?

Do you want instrument CompletableFuture? And join?

I just have concerns about whether instruments others in other libs. 
But, basically, I am good about this proposal.
Executor is used at the bottom. Can we implement it directly?
Ha. Fun time.

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/2066#issuecomment-535312082
Hope this helps.
It is caused by your Elasticsearch template not created correctly. Maybe upgrade from old version.

> It is caused by your Elasticsearch template not created correctly. Maybe upgrade from old version.

Elasticsearch template was created by skywalking. Is there an update to the skywalking version or Elasticsearch version?
@wu-sheng I am now using the skywalking version 6.3.0
ps : I have thonght trace data  and metric data transport in diffrent way , not effect each other .   but  I found  span cant upstream , the metric also cannot display in web UI
This shadow dump usually means some plugins having issues. Didn't close span as expected, unless you really have very long trace(unlikely.)

In tech speaking, we could. But we should be carefully, because in my mind, to propagate context across threads, we may cause class type change.

You could try, and let's talk in the pull request.

> This shadow dump usually means some plugins having issues. Didn't close span as expected, unless you really have very long trace(unlikely.)

but  instance's CPU and memory metrics are also not displayed  in Web UI .   Do trace data and metric use the same channel transport ?
If instance shows up on dashboard selector , then channel is established.
But old SkyWalking doesn't create the template.

> But old SkyWalking doesn't create the template.

Here is a piece of code I saw in 6.3.0 to create the index template:

`boolean isAcknowledged = esClient.createTemplate(model.getName(), settings, mapping);`
The config is ant style, very similar to Spring. Please read the document.
Read #2653

Yes. Use this one, would you have interest to update document?

https://join.slack.com/t/the-asf/shared_invite/enQtNzc2ODE3MjI1MDk1LTAyZGJmNTg1NWZhNmVmOWZjMjA2MGUyOGY4MjE5ZGUwOTQxY2Q3MDBmNTM5YTllNGU4M2QyMzQ4M2U4ZjQ5YmY
The link could be found here. https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/INFRA/Slack+Guest+Invites
6.3.0 yes, but for older version, it is not. But the template is using the same name as old index name. It could conflict.

> 
> 
> I resolve this problem when I rebuild my oap-server... -.-
> 
> But now I get another problem, es, oap and ui are all in CST timezone like 'Tue, 02 Apr 2019 14:05:37 +0800' while I use the command 'date -R'.
> 
> If I choose UTC on UI, trace will appear. And if I use Asia/shanghai, I need select the range earlier than 8h.

I got the same problem, and I used docker-compose to deploy the elasticsearch oap and ui.  How did you solve this problemï¼Ÿ

> 6.3.0 yes, but for older version, it is not. But the template is using the same name as old index name. It could conflict.

Ok, I see. Thank you very much for your help
I have solved this problem.
This CI keeps in H40, which has DNS issue... Our exclusive CI env is still not ready. Let't wait for a while and run ci again.

> One major question
> How to resolve the extension capability issue based on the container image? You could notice there are plenty of integration solutions are using network protocol to replace SPI, because in Cloud Native, container is not very friendly to SPI mode

This patch did not remove the web hook implementation and thus it won't be worse than before, users can still use the web hook **out of box**, but it provides convenience for users that don't use containers.

> 
> And, do you read the latest English blog in our website? There is a DingTalk webhook forwarder open source project.

It's a forwarder, meaning that users should start one more process (maybe more, I'm not sure), with this patch, users have possibilities to just copy and paste a `jar` file(will be provided if this PR gets merged) into the `oap-libs`, and the third-party alarm system is supported with minimum effort.

Are there other concerns?

Concern no. But I am still stragling to be open to accept SPI style PR. We are using network integration today. I am afraid people begin to contribute SPI implementation, which cause more dependencices, without clear advantage
@xiaoy00 Could you provide demo codes about this?
The current [gateway test demo](https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases/tree/master/gateway-scenario), it would be better to enrich this case here.

>  The most important thing is, how do you prepare to make match happen. The match rule should be parent-span and current-span matched, and those two spans belonging to different services(instances).

Let me confirm, the only reason that we need to match the spans in zipkin but no need to match the spans in skywalking native spans is because, skywalking native spans' spanid can tell the sequence of spans made from the single segment,  while zipkin can not tell the SERVER spans' sequence without knowing the timestamp of CLIENT spans. Is that correct?

> That is one important part, and yes, we need to focus on this solution.

I have a quick way solving the problem.  I can setup a proxy layer for the span receiver, and based on the trace id, we can route the span to the target node for processing. The theory is kind of consistent hash ring. Do you agree for the quick solution?

>   1 What's the use of port 10800 11800 12800? I don't see any ports listening using 'netstat -anp | grep 12800' after SkyUI started.

`11800` is for collecting trace data, `12800` is for UI to query, it can't be more obvious that your backend is not started successfully (I don't see any ports listening using 'netstat -anp | grep 12800')

>   2 What do i need to config for agent using spring boot with a "java -jar" fashion?  Do I need to specify like 'java -javaagent:/path-to/skywalking-agent.jar
>   -Dskywalking.agent.service_name=trace-api
>   -Dskywalking.collector.backend_service=localhost:**myAgentPort**
>   -jar xxx.jar'

it's not **myAgentPort**, it should be **yourBackendPort** as the name `skywalking.collector.backend_service` suggests

>   3 I find 3 config files:
>   /config/application.yml(SW_CORE_REST_PORT:12800 | SW_CORE_GRPC_PORT:11800)
>   /webapp/webapp.yml(listOfServers: 127.0.0.1:12800)
>   /config/agent.config(SW_AGENT_COLLECTOR_BACKEND_SERVICES:127.0.0.1:11800), which I think related with my problem, but my agent's port is 8013.

>   When I have several backend(agent) services, need to change all these config files ?

most (if not all) of the configurations can be configured by command line parameters, such as `-DSW_CORE_REST_PORT=xxx`, but according to your questions above, I don't think you have read the documentation first, so **please read the documentation first before asking, otherwise, it would be difficult to communicate**
And, SkyWalking doesn't support ES 7 or 7+ for now, which is documented too

`startup.sh` prints `success` that means it has launched the processes. 

According to the message, I think you have to initialize.
@g29times if you're using JDK 8+, it's a known issue, because the recommended JDK version for OAP backend is JDK 8
@g29times if you're interested, please take a look at #3541 and see whether it resolves your problem
Maybe CI found the issue.

@yangyshdan the fact that how many traces can be collected depends on the power of your OAP backend nodes and your ES cluster, refer to our [user cases](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/powered-by.md#user-cases) to see how many traces are collected and what's the scale of the backend and ES cluster, pay special attention to the case of Yonghui Supermarket.

I've replayed the e2e tests under JDK 1.9 manually (which won't report check status back to this PR), let's wait and see the result, if it passes, I think it should **generally work on 1.9 and above**, https://builds.apache.org/job/skywalking-e2e-2/763/console

@ywf4026 learn how to search within this repo, you're requesting something that already exists.

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/agent-optional-plugins/trace-ignore-plugin.md

Seems we're making progress now 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15965696/65817044-55138f00-e235-11e9-9df0-9056a3ca12eb.png)
If you see it passed, reply me here. I am using phone only, today.

@wu-sheng it passes under JDK 9, see the selected/highlighted words below the screenshot
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15965696/65817234-6362aa80-e237-11e9-8b6d-d1ffe20dc180.png)
Cool. How about higher? 11 for example? I am thinking about we need JRE documentation update.

> Cool. How about higher? 11 for example? I am thinking about we need JRE documentation update.

I tested this afternoon locally with OpenJDK 12, it works fine too, so it's highly possible that it also works on JDK 10 and JDK11, do we need to replay this on the infra Jenkins?
Provided

The infra is setting up our VM. Please submit an issue to track the higher jdk tests.

In this PR, at least, we should update document.
Finally, but still 7%? Do we set the codebase right? Is test folder included?
Oops, I've made a mistake that the container in which our e2e runs is based on OpenJDK8, the JDK version in `Jenkinsfile-E2E` is just for compile time only, so we'll need some real tests
OK, so we haven't verified in 9+?

> OK, so we haven't verified in 9+?

I verified JDK12 locally, others are not verified yet
We may need much more resources if we want to verify every commit on those versions
OK. I think 9 and 11 are LTS versions, right? We could focus on that.

I see agent core souse(org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.jvm.memory.MemoryProvider), use MemoryMXBean.getNonHeapMemoryUsage.getMax get maxNonHeap value. 

see jdk document: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/lang/management/MemoryUsage.html

> getMax
> public long getMax()
> Returns the maximum amount of memory in bytes that can be used for memory management. This method returns -1 if the maximum memory size is undefined.
> This amount of memory is not guaranteed to be available for memory management if it is greater than the amount of committed memory. The Java virtual machine may fail to allocate memory even if the amount of used memory does not exceed this maximum size.
> 
> Returns:
> the maximum amount of memory in bytes; -1 if undefined.

According to this logic, when 'maxHeap' and 'maxNonHeap' are negative numbers, the front end does not display free, can it?
Let's enhance UI to support this.
/run ci

> The current [gateway test demo](https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases/tree/master/gateway-scenario), it would be better to enrich this case here.

I have already submitted the case on  [gateway test demo](https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases/tree/master/gateway-scenario), please have a look
Read #2653
We have it. If you want to update document, I think it is good. But we don't need another duplicated file.
You could try our online demo, if it is ok, then the issue is that, the SkyWalking isn't set up correctly.

That docker file is for your local test only. We indicated it in readme.

You could find the docker compose in skywalking-docker repo.
Infra is upgrading the whole jenkins master. We need to wait it finished. And recheck the ci scheduler again.

docker-compose.yml is to run image built by /docker folder located at main repo(github.com/apache/skywalking). the officail docker-compose.yml is released in https://github.com/apache/skywalking-docker/tree/master/6/6.4/compose
Hi @xiaoy00 , Please modify the code according to code style and modify testcase so that test cases can work.

> Hi @xiaoy00 , Please modify the code according to code style and modify testcase so that test cases can work.
you talk about gateway-2.1.x-plugin or  [gateway test demo ](https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases/tree/master/gateway-scenario) ?
Not yet. We don't have this now.
I used docker-compose to build project,the first time OK.When I remove some block in the dashboard and refresh dashboard ,the dashboard was broken. After rebuild , the dashboard is still error.

Fix gateway-2.1.x-plugin according to code style.
And make [gateway test demo ](https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases/tree/master/gateway-scenario) can work.
Merging.

> Fix gateway-2.1.x-plugin according to code style.
> And make [gateway test demo ](https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases/tree/master/gateway-scenario) can work.
check style is ok on my idea. 
demo can work too, by the way , its need redis to work. 
i dont know what's the error . and i showed you on QQ.
u can give me some error infos.
You should verify style by maven command. It is what we used on CI. Also, click details link, we have the logs.

The referred demo is integratuon test, you need to read the plugin tests document and change the codes, then make tests passed.

In open source, we need to make sure cases are checked in any further changes. But not just your local tests.
Please understand, we need to make sure the whole community good, and make sure all upstream changes are safe and could be reverified always.
You need to spend mire time on tests than code changes.
Please bring more test cases to us. And include more than 10 test cases in one pull request, which makes review easier.
@wu-sheng I want to get familiar with the submission process first.
I know. I just hope you could bring more in next time. This one is waiting for pmc review.
@wu-sheng the java source's liencse can be automatic generatedï¼Ÿnext time, I submit more test case.
Yes. IDEA has license header plugin. And we have a header file in root path.

I want the automatic generated on maven life cycle
```
<plugin>
	<groupId>com.mycila</groupId>
	<artifactId>license-maven-plugin</artifactId>
	<version>3.0</version>
	<executions>
		<execution>
			<phase>generate-sources</phase>
			<goals>
				<goal>remove</goal>
				<goal>format</goal>
			</goals>
		</execution>
	</executions>
	<configuration>
		<quiet>true</quiet>
		<header>${user.dir}/HEADER</header>
		<includes>
			<include>**/src/main/java/**</include>
			<include>**/src/test/java/**</include>
		</includes>
		<excludes>
			<exclude>**/generated/**</exclude>
		</excludes>
		<strictCheck>true</strictCheck>
		<mapping>
			<java>SLASHSTAR_STYLE</java>
		</mapping>
	</configuration>
</plugin>
```
License is an IP declarence. I prefer people take the responsibilities of their pull request codes, rather than add them randomly.
OK, I understand. thanks
@kezhenxu94 I understand your intentions about license.
English only. Read document before you submit any issue
Expectation is that the coverage should be higher than `7.363%` (current coverage on master)
2% increased.
@muyun12 did you check #3525 ? Is this PR similar to that one? See comments there please

@kezhenxu94 this PR is similar to [#3525](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/3525).  The reality I encountered was that I needed to integrate third-party webhooks to trigger the corresponding workflow. Based on this, the alarm plugin is enhanced to add extensions conveniently without changing the sw source code for each extension.
Webhook in http provides you the capability to integrate without changing codes.

> The reality I encountered was that I needed to integrate third-party webhooks to trigger the corresponding workflow.

For now, you have to set up your own http server and receive the alarm message from SkyWalking, and dispatch to third-party system in your http server.

And even if we're going to refactor the alarm plugin to SPI pattern (like #3525), we won't want to modify the existed configuration format for compatibility.
Increased
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
If that log runs in another thread, in default, yes there is no trace id there. If you want, you need another plugin to propagate context across threads.
CI failing? I am going to review this tomorrow.

I just tested on a Graal VM and the CPU/Memory/GC providers seem to work well without compatibility issue (see screenshot below), and this issue is rather stale, we'll close this if no further response from @leotu and @flycash 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15965696/66213546-9652e580-e6f2-11e9-80e2-769799fcacd6.png)

I think you need helm file in our repo, https://github.com/apache/skywalking-kubernetes/tree/master/helm-chart.

We haven't pushed them into official helm repo, and the recent severl release hasn't provided helm chart by @hanahmily
Wait 72 hours for update.

> Let me confirm, the only reason that we need to match the spans in zipkin but no need to match the spans in skywalking native spans is because, skywalking native spans' spanid can tell the sequence of spans made from the single segment, while zipkin can not tell the SERVER spans' sequence without knowing the timestamp of CLIENT spans. Is that correct?

This is for one, the other is, you can't tell the `server` span's parent is `client` span, because you could have `server` span as `server` span's parent, such as `Tomcat` span as `SpringMVC` span's parent.

> I have a quick way solving the problem. I can setup a proxy layer for the span receiver, and based on the trace id, we can route the span to the target node for processing. The theory is kind of consistent hash ring. Do you agree for the quick solution?

You could, but how much memory do you expect to cost, and how long timeout should be set, because you never know, there will or will not more span coming.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/66257746-7e04c880-e7cf-11e9-9864-59294f499550.png)

The generated codes still counted.
